meanings.definition: The prevention of dilution or reduction in value.
meanings.sent1: The antidilution of the solution ensured its strength remained constant.
meanings.sent2: The antidilution of the paint kept its color vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The antidilution of the recipe made sure the flavors stayed strong.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an antidilution, always maintaining her focus.
meanings.sent5: The antidilution of the perfume made it last all day.

meanings.definition: A provision in a contract or agreement that protects against dilution of ownership.
meanings.sent1: The antidilution clause in the agreement safeguarded their ownership shares.
meanings.sent2: The antidilution policy shielded the investors from losing control.
meanings.sent3: The antidilution rule was like a shield for their ownership rights.
meanings.sent4: Their unity acted as an antidilution, ensuring their collective power.
meanings.sent5: The antidilution measure secured their ownership interests.
